newsitem.title: CANADA: Manitoba to open Manitoba Hydro monopoly.
newsitem.headline: Manitoba to open Manitoba Hydro monopoly.

text.p: Manitoba's provincial government plans legislation in the current legislative session to open Manitoba Hydro's monopoly to U.S. utilities, a government spokesman said on Wednesday.
"This is just something we have to do to secure our U.S. markets and hopefully expand them," spokesman Roger Matas said in a phone interview.
The government-owned utility sells C$300 million of electricity a year to the United States, Matas said.
Matas said that in order to keep exporting power to the United States, Manitoba Hydro must open its power lines to U.S. competitors to comply with a 1992 U.S. law deregulating the U.S. industry.
